data.title: The Tribune Democrat
data.meta_description: Robert Bender passed away. This is the full obituary where you can share condolences and memories. Published in the The Tribune Democrat on 2015-10-10.
data.text:
BENDER – Robert N., 68, Johnstown, passed away Oct. 9, 2015, at Memorial Medical Center. Born Sept. 17, 1947, in Johnstown, son of Robert W. and Flornell (McLaughlin) Bender. Preceded in death by parents; grandfather, Nevin Bender; grandmother, Helen, wife of Robert Horner; grandparents, John and Nellie (Swank) McLaughlin; and many aunts, uncles and cousins. Survived by sister and brother-in-law, Pam and Jeff Kehl; nephew, Jeffrey Kehl II; niece, Laura, wife of Jason Campbell; great-niece, Caitlyn Campbell; great-nephew, Sean Campbell; and many loving cousins. Robert had degrees from Robert Morris University, West Liberty State, Drexel University and the University of Pennsylvania. He was a human resource consultant and vice president of Information Solutions Inc. He also was a pastry chef. Member of Ebensburg Junior Cadets and Blue Devils Drum and Bugle Corp. There will be no viewing, although the family invites you to share in a celebration of life service at 3 p.m. Saturday, Oct. 17, at Grove Avenue United Methodist Church, the Rev. Deb Groeger, officiating. Arrangements entrusted to Moskal & Kennedy Colonial Funeral Home, Johnstown. Memorial contributions may be sent to the American Heart Association in memory of Robert. Online condolences may be directed to the family at www.moskalandkennedyfuneralhome.com.

Published on October 10, 2015

Note: These are general guidelines; some florists may not be able to operate within these timelines. During peak periods such as Valentine’s Day, Memorial Day and most holidays, florists are not always able to keep up to demand. Tribute will contact you if there are any issues.

Plant a tree: How does it work

When your purchase is complete, a post will be made on the tribute wall of the deceased signifying the planting of a memorial tree.

An official certificate recognizing your purchase will be included with your email receipt. You can then forward the email to the family or print it and give it to them personally.

After an order is placed, our forestry partners will plant the tree in the area of greatest need (nearest the funeral home), according to the planting schedule for the year.

Due to seasonal conditions, the tree planting takes place during the spring and summer.

Tree Planting Timeline

Orders placed in:

January - May

Planting will take place in Spring or Summer of the same year.

June - December

Planting will take place in Spring of the following year.
